credit_line: Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf
dimensions:
Warp x Weft: 44.5 x 34.3 cm (17 1/2 x 13 1/2 in.)
Loom width: 17 1/2 in.
title: Woven portrait
medium:
Medium: silk
Technique: Jacquard woven, predominantly warp-faced plain weave (white) with a continuous  supplementary weft (black) variously bound on the front, which on the back is bound outside the picture as plain weave. Woven on a loom equipped with a Jacquard mechanism by Carquillat (died 1884).
description: White fabric with two woven pictures in shades of black, white and grays. On top, a portrait of Joseph-Marie Jacquard (1752-1834) after a portrait by Jean-Claude Bonnefond (1796-1860). Below, a picture of a loom with the Jacquard punch-card mechanism.
name: Woven portrait
